dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, remember that big Facebook ad boycott? The #StopHateforProfits campaign?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, remember that big Facebook ad boycott? The Stop Hate for Profits campaign?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, definitely. I mean, it felt like it was everywhere for a bit there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, definitely. I mean, it felt like it was everywhere for a bit there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it seems like, um, it didn't quite go as planned for the civil rights groups behind it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it seems like, um, it didn't quite go as planned for the civil rights groups behind it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that! Like, a lot of companies just, uh, didn't join in the end. Over 500 actually *failed* to join.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that! Like, a lot of companies just, uh, didn't join in the end. Over five hundred actually failed to join.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With over 500 companies having now joined the advertising boycott of Facebook called for by top civil rights groups...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And now, get this â€“ some investors are actually feeling *optimistic* about Facebook's potential for increased revenue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And now, get this - some investors are actually feeling optimistic about Facebook's potential for increased revenue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...some investors are concerned about the companys lost revenue...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Optimistic? Wow. I mean, Pfizer, Lego, Dunkin Donuts are, like, back in the fold, right? Or never really left?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Optimistic? Wow. I mean, Pfizer, Lego, Dunkin Donuts are, like, back in the fold, right? Or never really left?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...most recently joined by Pfizer, Lego and Dunkin Donutsannouncing that they will stop working with the tech giant as part of the #StopHateforProfits campaign...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And Facebook shares, get this, they soared by 8% last Friday. So much for the boycott.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And Facebook shares, get this, they soared by eight percent last Friday. So much for the boycott.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook shares initially plunged by 8% last Friday amid an increasing number of big brands...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Eight percent! That's huge. And the campaign, it's shrunk to fewer than 500 advertisers now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Eight percent! That's huge. And the campaign, it's shrunk to fewer than five hundred advertisers now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the #StopHateforProfits campaign, which has now grown to include more than 500 advertisers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. Most Wall Street firms are actually estimating over a 5% gain in overall revenue for Facebook.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. Most Wall Street firms are actually estimating over a five percent gain in overall revenue for Facebook.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...most Wall Street firms estimate that Facebook is still looking at less than a 5% hit to overall revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: See, that's where I get a bit confused though. Because then I also read that Wall Street is "generally quite bearish" on the stock. Like, downgrading buy ratings. How does that make sense?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: See, that's where I get a bit confused though. Because then I also read that Wall Street is generally quite bearish on the stock. Like, downgrading buy ratings. How does that make sense?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Wall Street firms generally remain quite bullish on the stock, with the large majority reiterating buy ratings...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, good point. I think it might be, like, a short-term vs. long-term thing? Or maybe some analysts are just more cautious.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, good point. I think it might be, like, a short-term versus long-term thing? Or maybe some analysts are just more cautious.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Could be. But then you have, um, Morgan Stanley talking about a nearly *billion-dollar* gain in revenue per month if they just get their top 100 advertisers fully on board. That's, that's massive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Could be. But then you have, um, Morgan Stanley talking about a nearly billion-dollar gain in revenue per month if they just get their top one hundred advertisers fully on board. That's, that's massive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a scenario where the company loses business from its top 100 advertisers, that would only be around a $1 billion hit to revenue per month, Morgan Stanley analyst Brian Nowak estimates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It is! But then, on the flip side, what about companies like Procter & Gamble pulling out? The article mentions Facebook has a "shrinking revenue base" with unwilling advertisers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is! But then, on the flip side, what about companies like Procter and Gamble pulling out? The article mentions Facebook has a shrinking revenue base with unwilling advertisers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...Facebook has a diverse revenue base, with millions of paying advertisers...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Right, P&G alone is, like, half a percent of their revenue. But, um, I guess maybe the sheer volume of other advertisers, or perhaps smaller ones, is making up for it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, P and G alone is, like, half a percent of their revenue. But, um, I guess maybe the sheer volume of other advertisers, or perhaps smaller ones, is making up for it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Procter & Gamble, for example, is the largest advertiser in the world but is estimated to account for less than 0.50% of Facebooks revenues, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, maybe. It just goes to show, like, how resilient these tech giants can be, huh? Despite all the pressure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, maybe. It just goes to show, like, how resilient these tech giants can be, huh? Despite all the pressure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. It's never as simple as it looks on the surface.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. It's never as simple as it looks on the surface.
